UI_visible_response: Read 19 web pagesView Page DetailsPeng Shuai is a Chinese professional tennis player who has had a significant impact on the sport. In November 2021, she posted on social media alleging that a former high-ranking Chinese government official, Vice Premier Zhang Gaoli, had sexually assaulted her. This post was quickly removed, and Peng disappeared from public view, sparking international concern for her safety. The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) suspended all its tournaments in China in response, citing concerns for Peng's well-being.Peng later denied making the sexual assault allegations, stating that there had been a misunderstanding. She appeared in public during the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, meeting with International Olympic Committee (IOC) President Thomas Bach and speaking to Western media. However, questions remained about her freedom of speech and the authenticity of her denials.In January 2025, the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announced that Shenzhen, China, would host the Billie Jean King Cup finals from 2025 to 2027. ITF President David Haggerty stated that he had spoken to Peng several times and was reassured that she was fine and safe. The ITF's decision to hold the event in China, despite the previous controversy, has been met with support from players and commercial partners.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: Peng Shuai is a Chinese professional tennis player who has had a significant impact on the sport. In November 2021, she posted on social media alleging that a former high-ranking Chinese government official, Vice Premier Zhang Gaoli, had sexually assaulted her[^7^]. This post was quickly removed, and Peng disappeared from public view, sparking international concern for her safety[^7^]. The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) suspended all its tournaments in China in response, citing concerns for Peng's well-being[^4^].Peng later denied making the sexual assault allegations, stating that there had been a misunderstanding. She appeared in public during the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, meeting with International Olympic Committee (IOC) President Thomas Bach and speaking to Western media[^3^]. However, questions remained about her freedom of speech and the authenticity of her denials[^3^].In January 2025, the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announced that Shenzhen, China, would host the Billie Jean King Cup finals from 2025 to 2027. ITF President David Haggerty stated that he had spoken to Peng several times and was reassured that she was fine and safe[^1^]. The ITF's decision to hold the event in China, despite the previous controversy, has been met with support from players and commercial partners[^1^].
